attributes.action: IGNORE THE HUMAN RIGHTS ACT IN RELATION TO ABU QUATADA
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background: THE PRIME MINISTER SHOULD IGNORE THE HUMAN RIGHTS ACT WITH REGARD TO ABU QUATADA AS HE IS INHUMAN, AS PROVEN BY HIS ACTS, AND PUT HIM ON THE NEXT AVAILABLE PLANE TO HIS HOMELAND.THIS WOULD HAVE THE ADVANTAGE OF PROVING THAT THE BRITISH PUBLIC ARE BEING SHOWN THAT THEIR HUMAN RIGHTS ARE OF IMPORTANCE AND DUE.

rejection.details:
Please note there is a similar petition at http://petitions.pm.gov.uk/EIDASA/
Please address the excessive use of capital letters; they make your petition hard to read.
reasons: Wording that needs to be amended, or is impossible to understand
Duplicate - this is similar to and/or overlaps with an existing petition or petitions
